intro: Mentha masneriana, commonly known as the Balkan mint, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a serrated margin. Its small, pale blue to purple flowers are borne in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Mentha masneriana is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
